name: 031_antechamber_officiousness_get
description: antechamber x, get, go, show, give, attack
expected_full_outputs:
Unlocked

Openned. 

Your score is now 10 out of 75

*** Gatehouse ***

You are in the Gatehouse. This sparse but serviceable room guards the entrance to the main castle. Once upon a time it no-doubt bristled with alert guards bearing gleaming arms. Today, it is filled with old furniture, cobwebs, and a musty smell. Dim light filters in from the arrow slits facing the moat while the shadows at the north end of the room hint at the darkness of the main castle beyond.

Upon the wall hangs a Shiny Sword of great antinquity. 

There is a Front Gate to the south and a Foreboding Archway to the north.

There is a Wooden Shelf here. The Wooden Shelf is empty. 

The Royal Hedgehog is here. The Royal Hedgehog is wearing: a Red Bandana.

Openned. The Paper Bag contains: a Baked Biscuit. 

With a yelp of grateful delight the starving hedgehog leaps upon the Baked Biscuit and begins to devour them.

The Royal Hedgehog is ravenously devouring the Stale Biscuits and is taking no notice of you at all.

Taken

Your score is now 20 out of 75

With the Shiny Sword in hand you are now armed and dangerous!

The Royal Hedgehog has eaten through half the Stale Biscuits but is still giving them all of its attention.

Your sword is glowing with a faint blue glow.

*** Antechamber ***

You are in a what feels more like a wide, tall-ceilinged corridor than a room. Apparently this is the room-before-the-room, the pre-room before the really, really grand room that comes after it. If so, the next room must be quite something because, back in it's day, this spot was clearly impressive. Alas, like all of the castle, it has fallen on dark times and now feels more sinister than grand. The east and west walls are bare stone with exits to the north and south. 

Near the north exit, on the west wall, there is a small alcove. It appears to have some kind of apparatus in it but you can't see it very well due to the dim light and the Guard Goblin standing in front of it, glowering at you. The whole north end of the room is cloaked in shadows that make you uneasy.

There is a Lit Archway to the south and an Iron Portcullis to the north.

The Guard Goblin is here. The Guard Goblin is holding a Grimy Axe. The Guard Goblin is wearing: a Big Medal.

Your sword has begun to glow very brightly

Wheeeeeee!!! (do you do this often?)

Dropped

With the Shiny Sword no longer in hand, you are a bit more approachable.

Your sword is no longer glowing.

Taken

With the Shiny Sword in hand you are now armed and dangerous!

Your sword has begun to glow very brightly

Ouch! Stop walking into walls!

Ouch! Stop walking into walls!

Ouch! Stop walking into walls!

Ouch! Stop walking into walls!

Ouch! Stop walking into walls!

Ouch! Stop walking into walls!

It should be emphasized that the sort of officiousness that the Guard Goblin displays is not of the kind that involves being overly helpful. Rather, it is the sort of officiousness that is assertive of authority in an annoyingly domineering way, especially with regard to petty or trivial rules and regulations. 

It is said that a foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds - and the Guard Goblin wears its astringent officiousness like a shiny badge of honor. It scrutinizes you with a displeased frown of disaproval and a captious shake of the head. At any moment the Guard Goblin looks likely to ask you whether you've recieved the memo about the new cover sheet for the Treaspassing Permit Suspension reports.

You can't take the Big Medal. It belongs to the Guard Goblin!

It seems that by entering the north side of the room you have violated a minor castle ordinance. The Guard Goblin is incensed and will not tolerate this flagrant defiance of orthodoxy!

The Guard Goblin attacks with the Grimy Axe and you attempt to parry with the Shiny Sword!

The Grimy Axe arcs through the air with a lightening-fast stroke. You are only barely able to parry the assult! 

It seems that by entering the north side of the room you have violated a minor castle ordinance. The Guard Goblin is incensed and will not tolerate this flagrant defiance of orthodoxy!

The Guard Goblin attacks with the Grimy Axe and you attempt to parry with the Shiny Sword!

The Grimy Axe arcs through the air with a lightening-fast stroke. You are only barely able to parry the assult! 

The Guard Goblin peers at you with malace from the north end of the room. It stands in the Alcove guarding a mysterious aperatus of some sort. It wears a crisply ironed uniform and gives off an air of hauty, even vicious, Officiousness. The Guard Goblin is armed and dangerous and clearly takes its guard duties very seriously. It would not be wise to approach the Iron Portcullis or the Alcove (or the Guard Goblin!) un-armed.

The Guard Goblin is holding a Grimy Axe. The Guard Goblin is wearing: a Big Medal.

It seems that by entering the north side of the room you have violated a minor castle ordinance. The Guard Goblin is incensed and will not tolerate this flagrant defiance of orthodoxy!

The Guard Goblin attacks with the Grimy Axe and you attempt to parry with the Shiny Sword!

The Grimy Axe arcs through the air with a lightening-fast stroke. You are only barely able to parry the assult! 

It seems that by entering the north side of the room you have violated a minor castle ordinance. The Guard Goblin is incensed and will not tolerate this flagrant defiance of orthodoxy!

The Guard Goblin attacks with the Grimy Axe and you attempt to parry with the Shiny Sword!

The Grimy Axe arcs through the air with a lightening-fast stroke. You are only barely able to parry the assult! 

It seems that by entering the north side of the room you have violated a minor castle ordinance. The Guard Goblin is incensed and will not tolerate this flagrant defiance of orthodoxy!

The Guard Goblin attacks with the Grimy Axe and you attempt to parry with the Shiny Sword!

The Grimy Axe arcs through the air with a lightening-fast stroke. You are only barely able to parry the assult! 

*** Antechamber ***

You are in a what feels more like a wide, tall-ceilinged corridor than a room. Apparently this is the room-before-the-room, the pre-room before the really, really grand room that comes after it. If so, the next room must be quite something because, back in it's day, this spot was clearly impressive. Alas, like all of the castle, it has fallen on dark times and now feels more sinister than grand. The east and west walls are bare stone with exits to the north and south. 

Near the north exit, on the west wall, there is a small alcove. It appears to have some kind of apparatus in it but you can't see it very well due to the dim light and the Guard Goblin standing in front of it, glowering at you. The whole north end of the room is cloaked in shadows that make you uneasy.

There is a Lit Archway to the south and an Iron Portcullis to the north.

The Guard Goblin is here. The Guard Goblin is holding a Grimy Axe. The Guard Goblin is wearing: a Big Medal.

The Guard Goblin glares at you with an officious expression of disdain and then imperiously motions for you to hand the item over for further inspection.

With the Shiny Sword no longer in hand, you are a bit more approachable.

The Guard Goblin pockets the item and mutters something about castle regulations that require the confiscation articles of dubious provenance from ill-favored vagrants.

The Guard Goblin glares at you with an officious expression of disdain and then imperiously motions for you to hand the item over for further inspection.

The Guard Goblin pockets the item and mutters something about castle regulations that require the confiscation articles of dubious provenance from ill-favored vagrants.

The Guard Goblin's face turns ashen at the sight of the Shiny Sword. It trembles and takes a step back.

With the Shiny Sword in hand you are now armed and dangerous!

The Guard Goblin blanches and backs away, terrified at the thought of even touching the Shiny Sword.

(with the Shiny Sword)

You attack with the Shiny Sword and the Guard Goblin attempts to parry with the Grimy Axe!

The Shiny Sword surges with power and lethal heft in your hand. A preternatural calm comes over you. You were born for this moment. Your raucous pub crawling days were a mere temporary distraction. You know in your bones that this primal showdown was meant to be and that, with the Shiny Sword at your command, you were meant to win it. Resolute, and with a confidence you have never even imagined having up until this very moment, you stride forward to meet your foe in battle.

The Shiny Sword swings through the air with a blazing-fast assault. The Guard Goblin is slain by the blazing-fast strike! 

Your score is now 25 out of 75

Your sword is no longer glowing.

*** Antechamber ***

You are standing in a what feels more like a wide, tall-ceilinged corridor than a room. Apparently this is the room-before-the-room, the pre-room before the really, really grand room that comes after it. If so, the next room must be quite something because back in it's day this spot was clearly impressive. Alas, like all of the castle it has fallen on dark times and now feels more sinister than grand. The east and west walls are bare stone with exits to the north and south. 

Near the north exit on the west wall there is a small alcove which contains a control panel.

There is a Lit Archway to the south and an Iron Portcullis to the north.

There is a Dead Goblin here. 

There is a Control Panel here. The Control Panel contains: a Left Lever, a Middle Lever, a Right Lever, and a Red Button. 

The following items are here: a Torn Note, a Rusty Key, a Cheese Wedge, a Grimy Axe, and a Big Medal. 

The Control Panel contains multiple levers and a button. There are no directions posted as to what the controls are for or how to use them (a clear ISO lapse if ever you've seen one!).

The Control Panel contains: a Left Lever, a Middle Lever, a Right Lever, and a Red Button. 

The Left Lever is old and rusty.

The Left Lever is down.

The Right Lever is old and rusty.

The Right Lever is down.

The Middle Lever is old and rusty.

The Middle Lever is down.

The Red Button is to the right of the three levers. You have no idea what it does but it's very big... and red... and shiny. Without concious intent, your hands begins to reach out to push the Big. Red. Shiny. Candy-Like. Button...

This must have dropped from the Goblin's hand when you slew it. The Torn Note is ragged and only barely readable.

On the Torn Note you see: Messy Handwriting. 

'..ode is 5. Don't tell anyo..'

*** Antechamber ***

You are standing in a what feels more like a wide, tall-ceilinged corridor than a room. Apparently this is the room-before-the-room, the pre-room before the really, really grand room that comes after it. If so, the next room must be quite something because back in it's day this spot was clearly impressive. Alas, like all of the castle it has fallen on dark times and now feels more sinister than grand. The east and west walls are bare stone with exits to the north and south. 

Near the north exit on the west wall there is a small alcove which contains a control panel.

There is a Lit Archway to the south and an Iron Portcullis to the north.

There is a Dead Goblin here. 

There is a Control Panel here. The Control Panel contains: a Left Lever, a Middle Lever, a Right Lever, and a Red Button. 

The following items are here: a Torn Note, a Rusty Key, a Cheese Wedge, a Grimy Axe, and a Big Medal. 

Even in its demise, the Dead Goblin looks fierce and resolute. Whoever dispatched this enemy must be an adventurer of some renown!

A nasty looking weapon - and poorly maintained too. If you ever get out of this castle you should set aside some time to polish it. You notice uppon inspection that there is some Small Printing on the handle.

On the Grimy Axe you see: Small Printing. 

'ACME AXE: Effective at dispatching small dragons, large crocodiles, and even the most agressive of trees.'
